benchmark_details.name: Matching Convexified Trajectory (MCT)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces the Matching Convexified Trajectory (MCT) method, which improves upon traditional Dataset Distillation techniques by creating a convexified expert trajectory that enhances optimization stability, convergence speed, and reduces storage requirements.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To present a novel Dataset Distillation method that improves stability and speed of model training while reducing memory consumption.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The enhancement in validation accuracy is limited by the choice of starting and ending points and the simplified calculation of trajectory characteristics.

methodology.calculation: Distillation accuracy is computed based on the average accuracy of networks trained on synthetic datasets.
methodology.interpretation: The validation accuracy trends indicate how quickly and stably the model converges using the proposed method compared to traditional methods.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison against Dataset Condensation (DC), Distribution Matching (DM), and Matching Training Trajectories (MTT) showed MCT achieved superior performance across benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments validated the method across multiple datasets.
